page.title: 11Norwell, Cromwell's Churches
page.content: A church existed in{Norwell}at the time of the{1086}survey. The Parish {Church of St. Lawrence}has undergone numerous additions and restorations over the years. The moat where once stood{Overhall,}one of 3 Manor houses, can be seen from the tower. In{1985 the churchyard wall is being taken down at rebuilt at a cost of{Â£3,700. The work is being done by the local Council's Community Programme, a government backed scheme to help train and find work for young unemployed. The{Methodist Chapel}of{1843,}with it's additition for a{Sunday School in{1909,}still serves the community although attendances are small. There has been a church at{Cromwell since{Saxon}times. The Parish{Church {of St. Giles}is well maintained and congregations average about{10,}good for a village of only{160}residents.
